comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
I cannot find the 'AssemblyInfo.cs' for wsman.management and wsman.runtime. I think we need to add them.
For wsman.management, you can refer to: (AssemblyVersionAttribute and SupressMessageAttributes)
`%object_root%\admin\wmi\wmx\cmdlets\management\latest\objchk\amd64\AssemblyInfo.cs`
`%object_root%\admin\wmi\wmx\cmdlets\management\latest\objchk\amd64\_generated.cs`

For wsman.runtime, you can refer to: (at least the AssemblyVersionAttribute is needed)
`%object_root%\admin\wmi\wmx\cmdlets\runtime\latest\objchk\amd64\_generated.cs`

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
- AssemblyVersionAttribute thru dotnet cli version field, no need in putting it in AssemlbyInfo.cs
- SupressMessageAttributes not needed as far as we don't use FxCop and we don't at the moment.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @vors I believe some sub-projects have AssemblyVersionAttribute defined in AssemblyInfo.cs. We need to clean them up then.

comments.author: Indhukrishna
comments.body: We need AssemblyInfo.cs for Wsman.Management and WSMan.Runtime. Else, they default to 1.0.0.0. But on Windows PowerShell, they need to be 3.0.0.0
